abstract: Twelve people are killed and at least 45 more are injured after man drives truck through Christmas market in Berlin; event immediately recalls similar attack in Nice, France, which claimed 80 lives during Bastille Day celebration.

byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Megan Specia contributed reporting from New York, and Joanna Berendt from Warsaw.

lead_paragraph: Police said the truck jumped the sidewalk and drove into crowds at a holiday market, killing 12 and injuring dozens. The suspected driver was arrested.

headline.main: Berlin Crash Is Suspected to Be a Terror Attack, Police Say
headline.print_headline: 12 Dead in Berlin as Truck Strikes Holiday Crowds
